meanings.definition: The act of departing before a journey or trip.
meanings.sent1: Her predepartures always involve checking her luggage twice.
meanings.sent2: The airport was bustling with predepartures eager to start their vacations.
meanings.sent3: His predepartures are so meticulous, he even says goodbye to his houseplants.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the air during predepartures is like a balloon ready to burst.
meanings.sent5: The predepartures of the birds in the morning sky painted a beautiful scene.

meanings.definition: Something that occurs before a departure.
meanings.sent1: The predepartures of the crew included final safety checks.
meanings.sent2: The predepartures of the students involved saying goodbye to their friends.
meanings.sent3: The predepartures of the squirrels gathering nuts were quite entertaining to watch.
meanings.sent4: The predepartures of the storm clouds signaled an impending downpour.
meanings.sent5: The predepartures of the flowers blooming heralded the arrival of spring.

meanings.definition: A state of being prepared to leave for a destination.
meanings.sent1: The family's predepartures included packing snacks for the road trip.
meanings.sent2: The predepartures of the hikers involved checking their gear and supplies.
meanings.sent3: His predepartures for the camping trip included practicing setting up the tent.

meanings.sent5: The predepartures of the runners at the starting line showed their focus and determination.
